intro: Oreogrammitis glossophylla, commonly known as the glossy-leaf moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, carpet-like growth habit and dark green, glossy leaves that are often curled or twisted. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. Oreogrammitis glossophylla plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
